formulas: k \leftrightarrow f \;\; \text{via transfer function + expansion history}
\Omega_{\rm gw,0} \approx (\Omega_{r,0}/24)\, r A_s \;\; (\text{radiation-era re-entry; scale-invariant baseline})
gaps: A publication-grade module should include transfer functions (bounce + reheating), k→f mapping through the full history, and a proper likelihood against PTA/LIGO/CMB datasets.
inputs: cosmology snapshot: tfpt_suite/data/k_calibration.json (Ω_r,0 used for Ω_gw normalization)
spec.name: GW background predictor (Ω_gw(f); scale-invariant Starobinsky baseline + bounds ledger)
objective: Provide a falsifiable Ω_gw(f) baseline beyond the bounds-only placeholder module.
outputs: Starobinsky r(N) baseline and inferred tensor amplitude A_t=r·A_s at pivot
scale-invariant Ω_gw,0 estimate and a small frequency table (CMB pivot / PTA / LIGO)
spec.question: Is a full stochastic GW background prediction Ω_gw(f) implemented and compared to PTA/LIGO/CMB bounds?
validation: Produces a deterministic baseline Ω_gw(f) estimate from Starobinsky r and the cosmology snapshot.
Emits a PASS/FAIL ledger against conservative PTA/LIGO/BBN bounds (engineering-level; update with a full likelihood when needed).
